folders.description: Impatiens Noli me tangere [G].
Euonymus europaeus [TA].
Ceratophyllum demersum [TA]. i. "Ceratophyll: Hounsslow Heath River" [JL].
Ceratophyllum demersum [G]. i. "somewhere in the West" [JL].
Ceratophyllum demersum [G]. i. "Ceratophyllum demersum" [JL].
Folder 1. Atriplex hastata [G]. i. "Atriplex hastata var. - an Huds: By the Sea Side at Cley in Norfolk" [JL].

Folder 2. Atriplex hastata var. [G]. i. "No.1 Atrip: hastata var. Huds: Atrip: pedunculata var. is s'd to have been found near Lynn in Norfolk by Plukenet. See Ray p.153.n 9" [JL]. ii. "N II. Atriplex hastata var. Huds. Atriplex maritima ad foliosum basin auriculata procumbens, & ne vix cinnata. Ray 152" [JL].
Folder 3. Atriplex hastata? [G]. i. "N 2. The Seed of N 1. Sown in the Garden produced N 2" [?]; "I see no specific Difference whatever might be in the Habit" [JL].
Folder 4. Atriplex hastata var. tatarica Huds.? [G].
Folder 5. Atriplex hastata var. [G]. i. "An eadem cum altera? It seems to be a Chenopod: the same Place" [JL]. ii. "Atriplex hastata? It grows procumbent. Greys Thor:" [JL].
Folder 1. Atriplex laciniata [G]. i. "Lodmore Beach. Stones" [JL]. ii. "Weymouth" [JL]. iii. "from Mr. Sheffield" [JL].
Folder 2. Atriplex laciniata [TA]. i. "Feversham [probably Favershamnear Canterbury in Kent] [JL].
Folder 1. Atriplex littoralis [G]. "Dorsetshire I think at Weymouth" [JL].
Folder 2. Atriplex littoralis [TA].

Folder 3. Atriplex serrata [TA]. i. "This I take to be the Atriplex [laciniata deleted by JL] Lin: marina Lin: serrata Huds: Atriplex maritima Ray at Sheerness" [JL]. ii. "Atriplex serrata Hud: marina Lin: Indented Sea Orache" [JL].
Folder 4. Atriplex serrata [G].
Folder 1. Atriplex patula [G]. i. "This I think from Pembrokeshire Coast" [JL].
Folder 2. Atriplex patula [G].

Folder 3. Atriplex hastata [G]. "Atriplex hastata var? seu Atriplex patulae var. maritima? Videtur esse Atriplex sylvestris polygoni folio similis, spi... [illegible] seminalibus dense stipatis. R. Syn: p. 151. Nota sub N 1. On the Sea Shore at Cley in Norfolk" [JL].
Folder 4. Atriplex hastata [G].

species.speciesName: Beta vulgaris L. subsp. maritima (L.) Thell.

folders.description: Folder 1. Beta maritima [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 150 (1777). i. "Beta vulgaris Lin: Beta sylvestris maritima. Ray. Sea Beet. 5- and: 2-gyn. At Sheerness. Cal: 5-phyll: Corol: 0. Semen intra substantiam calycis" [JL].
Folder 2. Beta vulgaris [TA].
Folder 1. Chenopodium album [G]. i. "Chen: album. certe. Cowley field" [JL]. ii. "Chenop: album. Cowley field [near Uxbridge in Middlesex], large" [JL].
Folder 2. Chenopodium album [TA]. i. "Chenop: album" [JL]. ii. "Chenop: album. Essex" [JL].
Folder 1. Chenopodium Bonus Henricus [TA].

Folder 1. Chenopodium glaucum [TA]. i. "Chenop: glaucum. Tothill fields" [JL]. ii. "Chenopodium glaucum. Wrasbury & Horton Common" [JL]. iii. "Chenop: glaucum. Horton common Dunghills & Mr. Harcourts, Wrasbury" [JL].
Folder 1. Chenopod: Hybridum [TA].

Folder 1. Chenopod. murale [TA]. i. "According to the Specimens in the Hort. siccus of Lin: this is the Chenopodium murale, not serotinum" [JL]. ii. "Ch: serot: Lin: has pretty large deltoid angular leaves, but no flowers, not unlike our viride" [JL]. iii. "Pool [Poole] in Dorset" [JL]. iv. "Chenopod. murale. ubique" [JL].

Gnaphalium alpinum [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, t. xx, 470 (1777); Gnaphalium supinum [TA]. i. "Gnaphalium alpinum. Draw exactly from the Specimen, only make the top Flower like the middle one, & express the Woolliness of the Leaves. It is figur'd in the Fl: Dan: Tab: 332, but not to please me" [JL] [instructions presumably to the artist Moses Griffiths]. ii. "On comparing this with the Specimens in the Hort: Sicc: Lin: it appears that this Plant is his Gnaph: supinum Lin:" [JL].
Gnaphalium sylvaticum Huds. and G. rectum [G]. i. "Gnaphalium Anglicum" [JL].
Gnaphalium sylvaticum [TA]; Huds. [G]; Gnaphalium rectum [G].
Gnaphalium uliginosum [TA].
Hieraceum alpinum [G]. i. "No. 66. Corry-yaal" [John Stuart]; "Hierac: alpin: the true" [JL]. ii. "No. 65. Corry-yaal in Glenco" [John Stuart]; "Hieracium alpin: a var. only" [JL].
Hieracium alpinum [G].
Hieracium dubium [G]. i. "hab: in pratis upl: varius. Rarissime A palsim occurit major Hieracio auric: forte hybrida vel alia qualiscunque varietae omnibus partibus major nec repens" [?].
Hieracium dubium [TA]; Hieracium auricula [G]. i. "H: dubium? Kew" [JL].

species.speciesName: Hieracium murorum agg., Flora Scotica ed. 1, 437 (1777)

folders.description: Hieracium murorum [TA]. i. "Hieracium murorum Albury Surrey & c." [JL]. ii. "Pulmonar: Gallica" [JL].

Hieracium murorum [G]. i. "I consider these a Var: of H. murorum. That w: oval Leaves & naked Stalks grows near Spring plentifully. It is the same w: Mr. Yald: [Thomas Yalden] H: muror: in the Catalog: of Plants in the Rink's Park, the other has lanceolate &... [reverse of label obscured]" [JL].
Hieracium murorum [G]. i. "a garden specimen?" [G].
Hieracium murorum [G]. i. "Hier: umbellat: Scotland. Yalden" [JL]. ii. "Pembrokeshire. Holkam [? Rev. John Holcombe] [JL]."
Hieraceum sabaudum [G], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 439 (1777). i. "Hieracium sabaudum" [JL].
Hieracium sabaudum [G].
Hieracium sabaudum L: f: a Starv'd [TA].
Hieracium pilosella [TA].
Hieracium umbellatum [TA]. i. "Hier: umbellat: Scotland. Yalden" [JL]. ii. "Pembrokeshire. Holkam [? Rev. John Holcombe] [JL]."
Hieracium umbellatum [G].
Hypochoeris glabra [TA].

Hypochoeris glabra [G]. i. "Hypochoeris glabra. I send you this plant again for Re examination because it is not foliis glabris, sed ciliatisnor does it agree w:th Ray's Description" [B]; "Bryant" [JL]; "must be Hypochaeris glabra" [JL]. ii. "Hypochoeris glabra. Between the 7 & 8 Mile Stones, on Cawston heath, in the Road from Norwich to the Wood-Row. plentifully" [B].

Folder 1. Cornus suecica [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 119, 1116(1777). i. Cites Linn. Sp. Pl. 118; Ray's Syn. 261. ii. "Dwarf Honey-suckle. June. Upon the Cheviot Hills in Northumberland; & in a Place call'd Hold of Hurkam upon the Moors North of Pickering near Malton, Yorkshire" [JL]. iii. "Ross shire. L. Broom [Loch Broom]" [JL].
Folder 2. Cornus canadensis [TA]; Cornus suecica [G]. i. "Cornus canadensis, ramis nullis. Newfoundland. M' Banks" [JL].
Folder 1. Cornus sanguinea [TA]. i. "Cornus canadensis, ramis nullis. Newfoundland. M' Banks" [JL]. [Specimen apparently given by Joseph Banks.]
Erysimum Alliaria [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 356 (1777).

Turritis hirsuta [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 358 (1777). i. "I must beg Leave, my good Friend, to retract what I mentioned to you concerning the plant I picked up in Glostershire, for on Inspection, I perceived my mistake. I likewise examined Dr. Randolph's Specimens of Cardamine bellidifolia & found them all Turritis hirsuta, tho' He said Dr. Dillenius gave Him one of the Specimens I sawtogether w' th the nameI have enclosed a Specimen of the plant ICataloguecollected which you will easily knowas it is our Election Week all the fellows are up, so that I have scarce time to say how much I am obliged by the curious specimens Mr. Woods brought that I am & always shall be yr. affectionate Friend & Serv. W. Sheffield [Keeper of the Museum at Oxford]. Are you got thro' the Syngenescallass? WorColl. [presumably Worcester College, Oxford] Friday afternoon" [Sheffield].

Turritis hirsuta [TA]. i. "Thlaspi Hirsuta. These Specimens I found in a Lane upon a dytch Bank on the right hand going from Rochdale to Middletown the footway, not noted in the same place before" [?]. ii. "Turritis hirsuta" [JL].
Cardamine petraea [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 347 (1777). i. "Scotland" [JL].
Cardamine petraea [G]. i. "Clogwyn d" [JL]. ii. "Cardamine petraea. Clogwyn d yr Arddu. Snowden. June 16th. 1767" [?].
Arabis turrita [TA]. i. "Arabis turrita, near Oxford" [JL]. [Also on this folder is a pencil sketch of an Arabis species, probably by JL; see under Arabis sp.]

Arabis Alpina? a Var: seu Arabis Bellidifolia? or a new Species? Type of the radical Leaves red setae. Arabis Thaliana comes near. [here a pencil sketch of the plant, almost certainly by JL] Tetradyamia siliquosa, small white entire Petals, shut Calyx, about 6 flowers at Top. radical Leaves two Dents in them their Petioles scarcely hairy, the rest smooth" [JL].
Erysimum barbara [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 355 (1777).
Erysimum barbara [G].
Brassica napus [TA]. i. "Brassica Napus. Scotland. Yalden" [JL].
Brassica napus? [TA].
Erysimum officinale [G].
Brassica oleracea [TA]. i. "Chepstone Castle & Tenbigh Castle" [JL].
Brassica oleracea [G]. i. "Tenbigh [Tenby]" [JL].
Bunias Cakile [G], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 363 (1777).
Myagrum Sativum [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 336 (1777). i. "Myagrum sativum. These are the best I have" [P]; by Mr. Pitchford [JL]. ii. "Myagrum sativum. Gold of Pleasure. Kew. Aug. Anglia" [JL].
Myagrum sativum. These are the best I have" [P]; by Mr. Pitchford [JL]. ii. "Myagrum sativum. Gold of Pleasure. Kew. Aug. Anglia" [JL].

Thlaspi Bursa-pastoris [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 342 (1777); Thlaspi alpestris [G]. i. "Send a specimen of Thlas: perfoliatum" [JL]. ii. "Thlaspi Bursa Pastoris. var. No. 12" [B]. iii. "It is truly a Var: of Th: Bursa pastoris as you suppose, & not the Thlaspi alpestre, wch last I never saw, unless it be merely an unbranched var: of Th: perfoliatum, wch is not uncommon, & I believe is what Huds: means" [JL].
Bryonia alba [TA].

Drosera longifolia [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 175, 1098 (1777). i. "Drosera longifolia 5- and: 5-g." [JL]. ii. "Scotland" [JL]. [A mixed gathering; central specimen and two lowest ones are D. anglica]
Drosera rotundifolia [TA].
Frankenia laevis. At Cley, on the Beach towards Salthouse [small villages on the north Norfolk coast near Blakeney]
Frankenia pulverulenta. Africa leg. Thouars

Frankenia pulverulenta. Flos in quinque petala dividitur ad tubulum cohaerentia, basi denuo petala separatum & arcte amplex... [illegible] fructum oblongum pentagonum, monangium, plurimus seminibus fatum. Calyx longus striatus, quinquefidus est. Flores arcte geniculis ramulosum adnascuntum

species.speciesName: Centaurium pulchellum (Sw.) Druce [See under C. erythraea]

folders.description: Cicendia filiformis (L.) Delarbre 1 folder. Gentiana filiformis [TA]; Exacum filiforme. English Botany. Sowerby [G]. i. "Pool [Poole, Dorset] Heath & Cornwall" [JL]. ii. "Isle of Purbeck near Corf [Corfe, Dorset]" [JL]. iii. "Isle of Purbeck. Dorset" [JL]. iv. "The little yellow Marsh Centory. In Rotten marshy Gound in Dorsetshire, Devonshire, & Cornwall. July & August" [JL].
Gentiana pneumonanthe [TA]. i. "Gentiana Pneumonanthe. Lin: Stockton Heath near York" [JL].
Gentiana Amarella [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 152 (1777).

Gentiana campestris vide Pentandria Digynia [TA], Flora Scotica ed. 1, 152 (1777). i. "Gen: campestris. Teesdale" [JL]. ii. "Gentiana campestris Hud:" [? Banks]. iii. "Gentiana campestris. Wales. Mr Banks" [JL].
Gentiana amarella [G]. i. "Scotland" [JL].

Swertia perennis [TA]. i. "Swertia perennis Lin: ex Helvetia a D. Banks" [JL]. [One of Banks' specimens from Switzerland.] [For distribution see Flora Europaea: "Wet places, mainly in the mountains. From NC France & NW Russia southwards to N Spain, Bulgaria & S Ural."]
Ribes Rubra [TA]; R. alpinum [G].
